ygData.subject: Re: bug in config/configure ?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Harry, I modified the #undef HAS_NUMERIC to #define HAS_NUMERIC in the config.h.in file, but it did not help. Michael, did you solve the problem?

Hello Harry,

I modified the "#undef HAS_NUMERIC" to "#define HAS_NUMERIC" =
in the
config.h.in file, but it did not help. Michael, did you solve the pr=
oblem?

Regards,

Werner
--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Moffat, Harry K" =
<hkmoffa@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>    The default changed from using the Numeri=
c package to using the
> numarray package for Python's matrix operations. I=
 think you have to set
> USE_NUMERIC to 'y' in the preconfig file, and then=
 try again.
> 
> Best wishes,
> Harry

> > Hi group
> > 
> > I'm trying to write a script which largely automates=
 the 
> > download/configureation/build/installation of Cantera on the 
> >=
 institutes computers (some of the people here are not very fluent in 
> > =
installing things on linux).
> > 
> > A problem I encountered is, that the =
configure script always tries to 
> > build the F90 interface, no matter wh=
at value BUILD_F90_INTERFACE has.
> > I tracked it down into the config/con=
figure script, where the 
> > BUILD_F90 variable is assigned correctly 0 or=
 1. But then, further on,
> 
> > the latter variable is used in an if state=
ment with test -n:
> > 
> > if test -n ${BUILD_F90}; then
> > 
> > which wi=
ll always result in true. If I'm not mistaken, it should read
> > 
> > if [=
 $BUILD_F90 =3D 1 ]; then
> > 
> > 
> > This concerns the source package of=
 version 1.6.0.
> > 
> > 
> > Michael
